title: Ordering of CUDNN versions
body_html:
Hello,

thank you for pytorch! I sincerely enjoy toying around with it.

In pytorch/torch/backends/cudnn/init.py the ordering of cudnn versions to be loaded is

'libcudnn.so.6.0.5', 'libcudnn.so.6.0.10', 'libcudnn.so.5.1.5', 'libcudnn.so.5.1.3',
'libcudnn.so.5.0.5', 'libcudnn.so.5.1.10'

If there isn't a reason to not use 5.1.10, (or 6.0.10 for that matter), it would be great to use descending order.
I ran into this when using RNN with dropout while having libcudnn 5.0.5 and 5.1.10 installed in parallel and got "dropout supported only in cudnn v5.1 and above" from rnn.py:211 much to my surprise.

Thank you

Thomas

thank you for pytorch! I sincerely enjoy toying around with it.
In pytorch/torch/backends/cudnn/init.py the ordering of cudnn versions to be loaded is
'libcudnn.so.6.0.5', 'libcudnn.so.6.0.10', 'libcudnn.so.5.1.5', 'libcudnn.so.5.1.3',
'libcudnn.so.5.0.5', 'libcudnn.so.5.1.10'
If there isn't a reason to not use 5.1.10, (or 6.0.10 for that matter), it would be great to use descending order.
I ran into this when using RNN with dropout while having libcudnn 5.0.5 and 5.1.10 installed in parallel and got "dropout supported only in cudnn v5.1 and above" from rnn.py:211 much to my surprise.
Thank you
Thomas
body:
Hello,

thank you for pytorch! I sincerely enjoy toying around with it.

In pytorch/torch/backends/cudnn/__init__.py the ordering of cudnn versions to be loaded is

'libcudnn.so.6.0.5', 'libcudnn.so.6.0.10', 'libcudnn.so.5.1.5', 'libcudnn.so.5.1.3',
'libcudnn.so.5.0.5', 'libcudnn.so.5.1.10'

If there isn't a reason to not use 5.1.10, (or 6.0.10 for that matter), it would be great to use descending order.
I ran into this when using RNN with dropout while having libcudnn 5.0.5 and 5.1.10 installed in parallel and got "dropout supported only in cudnn v5.1 and above" from rnn.py:211 much to my surprise.

Thank you

Thomas
